name: Hotel Acta Madfor

reviews.text: I was in Madrid recently for business (= one hotel) then pleasure (= the Madfor hotel).
reviews.title: Basic but functional

reviews.text: Compared with the fancy hotel I had been in for the first two nights the Madfor is pretty good value. Spacious rooms.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: What I didn't like was the noise! There is no carpet in the hallway to absorb sound and the walls are thin so you hear everything and not always want you want to hear from the couple next door in the middle of the night !! But footsteps and talking could easily be heard.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: I had a problem that the shower water kept changing temperature and would go cold suddenly. But the walk in shower was nice.
reviews.title: Good hotel in Madrid

reviews.text: Location is near a metro stop but not a lot is going on in the area. Easy to get out & about. By day you can walk to the Palace (about 20 minutes) but in the evening was taking a taxi back.
reviews.title: Location, location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very beautiful hotel, with great location, friendly staff and great restaurant. We are very much impressed with their service.
reviews.title: brilliant

reviews.text: We certainly will recommend to our friends and we enjoyed all the time here.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

reviews.text: I booked this hotel because of its location, just across the street from Principe Pio train station and walking distance to Plaza de Espana, Gran Via, Sol, Plaza Mayor, etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: The hotel has been recently refurbished and its impeccable. Nice views with double windows to isolate from the noisy street and very friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: More than a 3 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was for sure a very good election for my stay in Madrid.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: The location is so convenient - you take a metro from the airport. They are across the road from the metro, bus station and mall. The rooms are stunning, clean with lovely views. The lounge area is stylish and there's are common kitchen area. The staff are friendly and helpful from reception to the cleaners. The facilities are fantastic. I will definitely stay there again. High recommend. Suitable for everyone.
reviews.title: Best stay
Chic and refined
reviews.text: What a lovely chic hotel deserves 4stars,has everything you require for a city break,rooms perfect roomy,clean,modern..well the lounge area on the second floor is one of the best I have seen,fantastic for a chillax,coffee from the machines and a snack welcomed...restaurants next door..large shopping centre opposite with the usual,McDonald's,KFC,burger king and others,the sales are on at the moment so shop till we drop...came to watch the Spanish ladies open at campo de golf,but perfect for a range of tours..,they even have a microwave in the lounge area,they have thought of everything,even a change machine to get coins for the machines,however it's a bit of of site in the locker room...only one negative point,they need to shorten the drop lights in room 605 as the air con unit is next to them and could effect the flow,don't look at the lights for to long you could easily hypnotise yourself as they go round and round...will defiantly stay here again,cost 15euros from atchoa station to hotel,by taxi but well worth it....here for 5 days will update at the end...fab views from the balcony....stock up at the supermarket next door and enjoy...

The room we were given was nicely decorated, clean and comfortable but so small you can almost not move around the bed-having checked into another hotel in Spain now it seems this is the standard size for a budget hotel room. The location is fantastic as you're right by the palace, nice restaurants, a mall if you're into shopping. It worked for our overnight in Madrid as we arrived late and moved on the next day but I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a long stay. I wondered why the staff even bothered being in the hospitality industry because the two gentlemen on duty during our stay wasn't very friendly.
reviews.title: Good location, tiny room

reviews.text: A wonderful little hotel. Perfect location for everything, right opposite a lovely shopping mall and the bus/train/metro station.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The rooms were clean, well presented and modern. The bathroom was particularly pleasant. The one single problem is the laminate flooring which does create a lot of noise from other rooms and the hallway.
reviews.title: Happy

reviews.text: After reading through about 100 opinions on this place, I booked based on the cheapness and the mainly positive reviews - don't listen to the negative ones!
reviews.title: Don't ignore the great reviews - this hotel is brilliant!

reviews.text: It's in a great location (right opposite the Principe Pio station, which takes you directly into central Opera), is great value for money and the hotel itself is brilliant. The staff were friendly, rooms were clean, modern and tidy and they even sold Bugles (my favourite type of crisps that they haven't sold in the UK for about 10 years) in the vending machine!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: All in all a great hotel and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: A 3 on 5 !

reviews.text: Luke
reviews.title: Great for a short stay, functional, comfortable and in a good location for a very reasonable price.

reviews.text: Was very clean and safe, Staff was very helpful. Walking distance to everything, Enjoyed my stay, highly recommended to anyone. Had best shower ever had in hotel, bed was very comfy:) view was great. I LOVED THIS HOTEL, was recommended by co work
reviews.title: Three Star Hotel with a few Warts

description: The Hotel Acta Madfor is a 3star hotel with 102 rooms, located in the center of Madrid, within walking distance of the Royal Palace and Casa de Campo and minutes from one of the main arteries of the city. The hotel, with a modern design, offers customers the best features of comfort and relaxation, and has, from its sun terrace, one of the most spectacular views of the entire city of Madrid: the Royal Palace with its Gardens of Sabatini and Cathedral de la Almudena.
